intro: Trichodesma calcareum, commonly known as the limestone trichodesma, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often found in limestone areas. The plant features small, white to pale blue flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in hot, dry environments. Trichodesma calcareum is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
